name: 組織發展與變革研究
comment: 如果本校大三大四學生想修此全英語授課課程，請找任課教師拿授權碼。
description:
In the era of globalization, which has been spurred by quantum leaps in the field of Information and Communication Technology (ICT), companies have been faced with fast-paced and uncertain changes. This course will examine change in the workplace from multiple perspectives on technology, market competitiveness, and company ownership. 

This course is designed to train students relating to organization change and development in a competitive world. Packed with current examples that reflect the vibrancy of the international business field, this course offers a managerial approach that keeps an emphasis on organizational change management including strategy, diagnosis, motivation, resistance, communication, interventions and sustainability.

Discussions will consider various foundational issues in. Throughout this course, students will engage in various activities intended to illustrate or practice the skills involved in planning and implementing organizational change. This course will be taught using a combination of instructional methods including group discussions, student presentations, and independent study. Upon completion of course, students shall be able: 
1. To articulate and discuss the process of change management behind the stages of the process.
2. To gain a thorough understanding of the organization’s ability to assess its current functioning and ability to bring about major change in a way that gains support of organization members.
3. To interact with, analyze, and report on an organization that is currently managing a change process in the workplace.
goals: Overview of organization development and change: describe the important issues and trends in managing and developing transformations impacting the workplace and how those factors affect organizations and their work.

The process of organization development & change: explain the process through assessment, planning, implementing, gathering data and determining interventions to address organizational change initiatives.

Interventions for change: describe the main principles and characteristics of the multiple models for managing organizational change and apply those models in analyzing organizational change initiatives.

Applications of organization change and development is designed to help students:  1) Discuss issues, considerations, constraints, ingredients, and processes associated with intervention design. 2) Evaluate and assess an organizational change program. 3) Develop an awareness of influencing and facilitating change. 4) Discuss criteria for effective interventions.
syllabus:
Week 1

Introduction to curriculum framework, progress, and score assessment.

Week 2

Introduction to organization development.

Week 3

The Nature of planned change

Week 4

Entering and contracting and diagnosing

Week 5

Collecting, analyzing, and feeding back diagnostic information

Week 6

Designing interventions

Week 7

Managing change

Week 8-9 (Human process interventions)

1\. Interpersonal and group process approaches

2\. Organization process approaches

Week 10-11 (Techno-structural interventions)

1\. Structural designs

2\. Employee development

3\. Work design

Week 12-14( Human resource interventions)

1\. Performance management

2\. Talent management

3\. Workforce diversity and wellness

Week 15-16 (Strategic change interventions)

1\. Transformational change

2\. Continuous change

3\. Trans-organization change

Week 17-18 (Applications of organization development)

1\. Organization development for economic, ecological, and social outcomes.

2\. Future directions in organization development

3\. Final term paper

methodologies.note:
1. The course is designed to be both theoretical and experiential.
2. Important issues and trends in organization development and change will be introduced
Students will discuss related issues and trends introduced by the instructor and research topics presented by fellow students
Small teams will be established at the start of the semester to help facilitate case study and experience team work dynamics.
Students will carry out a research project to study a current problem or implication in organization development and change.

grading.note: Students are required to submit assigned project.
Students are required to present the project orally in class and submit the completed written research report (Final term paper) at the end of semester.
Students are encouraged to actively participate in class discussions to enrich the learning.
Students are required to introduce and present assigned readings in class.
